page.title: 14The Free Wood.
page.content: {William the Conqueror}appointed a man to do a survey on Hewelsfield village.He had to write down all the land cover but he wanted to keep a piece for the village and himself.So William never knew about{the Free Wood as it was called. People used to come and gather {as much wood as they could {carry}but they were not allowed to bring a cart and fill it with wood. It was only {the amount they could carry {they were allowed to take.}This happened every day for years.The { {mayor of Bath and Wells}still owns some of the Free Wood and it is fenced off.Some times people still go and collect wood from the free wood.
